intro: Cnidoscolus monsanto, commonly known as the "Mexican bristleleaf," is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a spiny capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its unique appearance and growth habits, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
